result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Landon C Taylor

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 2:28pm{This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
 Defendant Landon C Taylor appeared by video.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to Counsel reviewed; Mr. Taylor indicates that he intends to privately retain an attorney. 

Address is verified. 
recess: 2:31pm 
NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 11/21/22 at 11:00am
Mr. Taylor may appear by Zoom on 11/3/2022 @ 2:30 pm
Adjourned initial appearance on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 3:27pm
Defendant Landon C Taylor not in court.  DA Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today. 
DA Hall checks the DOC Locator resource; it indicates that Mr. Taylor is currently at the MSDF. 
recess 3:30pm

NEXT:  (1) clerk- add MSDF to the mailing matrix,  (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on November 3rd at 2:30pm--arrangements should be made for Mr. Taylor to appear by videoconference for this hearing
Adjourned initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:00pm 
Defendant Landon C Taylor appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck(PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls time limits

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond.
recess 2:03pm 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 10/20/22 at 3:00pm
